options.description: Automatically set based on resource and operation

options.name: Set Manually
options.description: Manually set the description

properties.name: toolDescription
properties.description: Explain to the LLM what this tool does, a good, specific description would allow LLMs to produce expected results much more often

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a light

options.name: Get
options.description: Retrieve a light

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Retrieve many lights

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a light

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: lightId
properties.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

properties.name: on
properties.description: On/Off state of the light

options.name: alert
None
options.description: The light is not performing an alert effect

options.name: Select
options.description: The light is performing one breathe cycle

options.name: LSelect
options.description: The light is performing breathe cycles for 15 seconds or until an "alert": "none" command is received
The alert effect, is a temporary change to the bulb’s state

options.name: bri
options.description: The brightness value to set the light to. Brightness is a scale from 1 (the minimum the light is capable of) to 254 (the maximum).

options.name: bri_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the brightness. This value is ignored if the Brightness attribute is provided.

options.name: ct
options.description: The Mired color temperature of the light. 2012 connected lights are capable of 153 (6500K) to 500 (2000K).

options.name: ct_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the ct. ct_inc is ignored if the ct attribute is provided.

options.name: xy
options.description: The x and y coordinates of a color in CIE color space. The first entry is the x coordinate and the second entry is the y coordinate. Both x and y are between 0 and 1

options.name: xy_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the xy. This value is ignored if the Coordinates attribute is provided. Any ongoing color transition is stopped. Max value [0.5, 0.5]

options.name: effect
options.description: The dynamic effect of the light

options.name: hue
options.description: The hue value to set light to.The hue value is a wrapping value between 0 and 65535. Both 0 and 65535 are red, 25500 is green and 46920 is blue.

options.name: hue_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the hue. Hue Increments is ignored if the Hue attribute is provided.

options.name: sat
options.description: Saturation of the light. 254 is the most saturated (colored) and 0 is the least saturated (white).

options.name: sat_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the sat. This value is ignored if the Saturation attribute is provided.

options.name: transitiontime
options.description: The duration in seconds of the transition from the light’s current state to the new state

name: n8n-nodes-base.pushover
description: Consume Pushover API

properties.name: userKey
properties.description: The user/group key (not e-mail address) of your user (or you), viewable when logged into the dashboard (often referred to as USER_KEY in the libraries and code examples)

properties.name: message
properties.description: Your message

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Send as -2 to generate no notification/alert, -1 to always send as a quiet notification, 1 to display as high-priority and bypass the user's quiet hours, or 2 to also require confirmation from the user

properties.name: retry
properties.description: Specifies how often (in seconds) the Pushover servers will send the same notification to the user. This parameter must have a value of at least 30 seconds between retries.

properties.name: expire
properties.description: Specifies how many seconds your notification will continue to be retried for (every retry seconds)

values.name: binaryPropertyName
values.hint: The name of the input binary field containing the file which should be added to email as attachment

options.name: device
options.description: Your user's device name to send the message directly to that device, rather than all of the user's devices (multiple devices may be separated by a comma)

options.name: html
options.description: Whether to enable messages formatting with HTML tags

options.name: sound
options.description: The name of one of the sounds supported by device clients to override the user's default sound choice. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: timestamp
options.description: A Unix timestamp of your message's date and time to display to the user, rather than the time your message is received by our API

options.name: title
options.description: Your message's title, otherwise your app's name is used

options.name: timestamp
options.description: A Unix timestamp of your message's date and time to display to the user, rather than the time your message is received by our API

options.name: url
options.description: A supplementary URL to show with your message

options.name: url_title
options.description: A title for your supplementary URL, otherwise just the URL is shown

name: n8n-nodes-base.rssFeedReadTrigger
description: Starts a workflow when an RSS feed is updated

properties.name: pollTimes
properties.description: Time at which polling should occur

values.name: mode
values.description: How often to trigger.

values.name: hour
values.description: The hour of the day to trigger (24h format)

values.name: minute
values.description: The minute of the day to trigger

values.name: dayOfMonth
values.description: The day of the month to trigger

values.name: weekday
values.description: The weekday to trigger

values.name: cronExpression
values.description:
Use custom cron expression. Values and ranges as follows:
  • Seconds: 0-59
  • Minutes: 0 - 59
  • Hours: 0 - 23
  • Day of Month: 1 - 31
  • Months: 0 - 11 (Jan - Dec)
  • Day of Week: 0 - 6 (Sun - Sat)

values.name: value
values.description: All how many X minutes/hours it should trigger

values.name: unit
values.description: If it should trigger all X minutes or hours

properties.name: feedUrl
properties.description: URL of the RSS feed to poll

description: Reads data from an RSS Feed

properties.name: url
properties.description: URL of the RSS feed

options.name: customFields
options.description: A comma-separated list of custom fields to include in the output. For example, "author, contentSnippet".

options.name: ignoreSSL
options.description: Whether to ignore SSL/TLS certificate issues or not
